item.title: [508] Spirit Beast Cache Loading - called on ints
item.dc:creator: @d3mons_dead d3mons dead
item.description:
@d3mons_dead wrote:

icereign2:

nice does he use the colored spirit attacks?

Thats in NPCplayer.java just set the spirirt beast npc to attack with projectiles,and if you want it to do somthing like attack with multipes set up a INT and make it Misc.random which u can set up to make it usae diffrent attack at random.

item.title: [508] Spirit Beast Cache Loading - called on ints
item.dc:creator: @LOLBanned LOLBanned
item.description:
@LOLBanned wrote:

[CENTER][B] [FONT=“Times New Roman”]So i saw this guide on adding a spirit beast with some .rar model a while ago. well that guide was just awful. in fact it was wrong, you don’t need to download an extra model for a spirit beast on 508, it’s in the cache! So for those of you wanting the spirit beast, follow this short guide to success.
Edit: my ints now give him animation, rather then twitch like he has turrets. he is also transparent not silver.

Here he is in GIF.

Open Client Folder

v

Open Java File

Class68_Sub13_Sub11

Search for

Class93.aClass98_1662.method1568(class80, 104, (long) i);

else search

if(i ==

v

under

Class93.aClass98_1662.method1568(class80, 104, (long) i);

or with the rest, add

if(i == 7995) //attackable { class80.aRSString_1466 = Class112.method1668(43, "Spirit Beast");//Name class80.anInt1444 = 785;//combat level class80.aBoolean1438 = true;//show yellow dot? class80.aBoolean1433 = true;//allow rightclicking? class80.aRSStringArray1432[1] = Class112.method1668(43, "Attack"); //class80.anInt1461 = 50;//resize width //class80.anInt1416 = 50;//resize height //class80.anInt1409 = 1232;//stand animation //class80.anIntArray1454 = new int[1];//model count //class80.anIntArray1454[0] = 2937;//model 1 }
or

if(i == 7996) //standing there doing shit all { class80.aRSString_1466 = Class112.method1668(43, "Spirit beast");//Name class80.anInt1444 = 9922;//combat level class80.aBoolean1438 = true;//show yellow dot? class80.anInt1439 = 0;//Set Headicon ID class80.aBoolean1433 = true;//allow rightclicking? //class80.anInt1461 = 200;//resize width //class80.anInt1416 = 200;//resize height //class80.anInt1409 = 1232;//stand animation //class80.anIntArray1454 = new int[1];//model count //class80.anIntArray1454[0] = 2937;//model 1 }
and if you want.

if(i == 7997) { class80.aRSString_1466 = Class112.method1668(43, "super spirit beast");//Name class80.anInt1444 = 666;//combat level //lmfao class80.aBoolean1438 = true;//show yellow dot? class80.anInt1439 = 7;//Set Headicon ID class80.aBoolean1433 = true;//allow rightclicking? //class80.anInt1461 = 300;//resize width //class80.anInt1416 = 300;//resize height //class80.anInt1409 = 1232;//stand animation //class80.anIntArray1454 = new int[1];//model count //class80.anIntArray1454[0] = 2937;//model 1 }
why are most of the ints comments out?

because they were not necessary. he was fine the way he was and he looked retarded the way that buddy had them so here is the fixed version, the real spirit beast, super spirit beast was just boredom.

when you have finished adding the ints, be sure you didnt do it inside another spots {
be sure to save.
Compile and finish.

1% credits to [COLOR=Blue]josue992222[/COLOR] for the bad TuT making me want to do this
99% credits to myself for doing it.
[/FONT]
[/CENTER]

Read full topic
